intro: Peperomia parhamii, commonly known as the Parham's peperomia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This compact plant typically grows to a height of about 10–15 centimeters, featuring glossy, ovate leaves that are dark green in color. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in hue. It is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its low maintenance requirements and ability to thrive in bright, indirect light.
